Hawkins|Ralph Hawkins]], CEO | industry = [[Architecture]] | products = | services = [[Architecture]], [[Interior Design|Interiors]], Graphics, Planning | market cap = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | assets = | equity = | owner = | num_employees = 800 | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = [http://hksinc.com/ HKS, Inc.] | footnotes = | intl = }} [[File:Cowboysstadium js.jpg|thumb|right|200px|[[Cowboys Stadium]] in [[Arlington, Texas]] was designed by HKS]] [[File:LucasOil.JPG|thumb|right|200px|[[Lucas Oil Stadium]] in [[Indianapolis]], [[Indiana]] was designed by HKS]] [[File:311_South_Wacker_Drive_060528.jpg|thumb|200px|[[311 South Wacker Drive]] in [[Chicago]] was designed by HKS]] '''HKS, Inc.''' is an international [[architecture|architecture firm]] headquartered in [[Dallas, Texas|Dallas]], [[Texas]] ([[United States|USA]]). It was founded in 1939 by [[Harwood K. Smith]], a native of [[Chicago]] and graduate of [[Texas A&M University]]. The firm employs over 850 people, making it one of the largest architectural firms in the [[United States]]. In 2002, HKS expanded its international presence by opening [[HKS Arquitectos]] in Mexico City to serve its Latin American clients. [http://uk.hksinc.com HKS Architects Limited] evolved out of the RyderHKS International firm and is based in [[London]] and focuses on healthcare, commercial, educational, hospitality and sports architecture in the United Kingdom and Europe. In 2006, HKS acquired the Stein-Cox Group and Trinity Design to have presences in [[Phoenix, Arizona]] and [[Detroit, Michigan]], respectively. In 2007, HKS expanded their hospitality architectural design services and also acquired the hospitality design firm Hill Glazier Architects, located in [[Palo Alto]]. The firm also opened offices in [[Miami]], [[Nashville]], [[Oklahoma City]], and [[Chennai]], [[India]]. HKS has expanded its global presence, in 2008 opening offices in [[Abu Dhabi]] and [[SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil|SÃ£o Paulo]], [[Brazil]] and again in 2010 with an office in [[Shanghai, China|Shanghai]], [[China]]http://hksinc.com/#/about-hks/news/press-releases/HKS-opens-Shanghai-office/. HKS has completed services on structures valued in excess of $45 billion, with more than $20 billion of construction currently underway. HKS completes more than 85% of its services as design architect. In addition to architectural design, HKS offers engineering and interior design services. The firm is a leader in the advancement of [[sustainable design]] and has more than {{convert|12000000|sqft|m2}} of sustainable space completed or in progress.{{Citation needed|date=March 2011}} HKS' advanced technology group offers several exclusive technologies, [[archengine|ARCHengine]]http://videogames.yahoo.com/feature/dallas-cowboys-new-stadium-built-with-videogame-technology/1288021, a technology developed by the direction of the HKS principals for uniquely communicating designs to clients through the use of 3D visual environments and [[BIMMIT]], a building information model, model input technology toolset for creating as-built BIM models.
